Content.Content:
[$BOX] [$CELL] [$BLOCK]

A client who will receive first generation cephalosporins like cefazolin must be first assessed for history of penicillin allergy. This is because clients who are allergic to penicillin may develop a cross-sensitivity reaction to cefazolin. Asking for the history of substance abuse and the clientâ€™s ability to adhere to medication will not prevent cross-sensitivity reaction. The nurse must ask the client for the presence of liver or kidney disease, not muscle disorders.

[$/BLOCK] [$/CELL] [$CELL] [$IMG("/media/Images/shutterstock_375751999.jpg";200,300;2)] [$/CELL] [$/BOX]
Content.Name: SAFE AND EFFECTIVE CARE ENVIRONMENT 336
